tool.name: SAGA.ta_morphometry.14
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayDEM False output_data_HO $output_data_HO output_data_HU $output_data_HU output_data_NH $output_data_NH output_data_SH $output_data_SH output_data_MS $output_data_MS name SAGA.ta_morphometry.14 DEM $DEM W $W T $T E $E prefer $prefer response $response outputType_HO $OutputSection_HO.outputType_HO transmissionMode_HO $OutputSection_HO.transmissionMode_HO outputType_HU $OutputSection_HU.outputType_HU transmissionMode_HU $OutputSection_HU.transmissionMode_HU outputType_NH $OutputSection_NH.outputType_NH transmissionMode_NH $OutputSection_NH.transmissionMode_NH outputType_SH $OutputSection_SH.outputType_SH transmissionMode_SH $OutputSection_SH.transmissionMode_SH outputType_MS $OutputSection_MS.outputType_MS transmissionMode_MS $OutputSection_MS.transmissionMode_MS

param.name: DEM
param.label: Elevation
param.help: Elevation The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, png, x-ogc-envi, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: W
param.label: w
param.help: The parameter weights the influence of catchment size on relative elevation (inversely proportional).

param.name: T
param.label: t
param.help: The parameter controls the amount by which a maximum in the neighbourhood of a cell is taken over into the cell (considering the local slope between the cells). The smaller 't' and/or the smaller the slope, the more of the maximum value is taken over into the cell. This results in a greater generalization/smoothing of the result. The greater 't' and/or the higher the slope, the less is taken over into the cell and the result will show a more irregular pattern caused by small changes in elevation between the cells.

param.name: E
param.label: e
param.help: The parameter controls the position of relative height maxima as a function of slope.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_HO
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

section.name: OutputSection_HU
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

section.name: OutputSection_NH
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

section.name: OutputSection_SH
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

section.name: OutputSection_MS
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

tool.help: The tool allows one to calculate several terrain indices from a digital elevation model.<br/><br/>General information on the computational concept can be found in:<br/>- Boehner, J. and Selige, T. (2006): Spatial prediction of soil attributes using terrain analysis and climate regionalisation. In: Boehner, J., McCloy, K.R., Strobl, J. [Ed.]: SAGA - Analysis and Modelling Applications, Goettinger Geographische Abhandlungen, Goettingen: 13-28. (<a target="_blank" href="http://downloads.sourceforge.net/saga-gis/gga115_02.pdf">pdf</a>)<br/><br/>
